head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Bronx: Suspect Rescued From Ledge

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Bronx: Suspect Rescued From Ledge

block.p: Police officers with the Emergency Services Unit broke through a window and grabbed a suspect who was clinging to a 23rd-story ledge of a building near the Bruckner Expressway early yesterday morning, the police said. The suspect, Francisco Correra Jr., was charged with assault and with violating an order of protection, the police said. Mr. Correra, 33, was charged with hitting his father about 5:30 a.m. at their apartment building at 950 Underhill Avenue, the police said. When officers arrived, Mr. Correra had left the apartment and gone to the building's roof, the police said.
Police officers with the Emergency Services Unit broke through a window and grabbed a suspect who was clinging to a 23rd-story ledge of a building near the Bruckner Expressway.
